poem:
**Diplomatic Shuffle**

In Kyiv's heart, leaders gather,  
their words a deck of cards,  
face down on the table.  
Putin and Trump watch the deal,  
shuffling threats, sanctions,   
a ceasefire,  
each hand played cautiously,  
with no endgame in sight—  
just the murmur of strategy,  
a poker-faced world  
waiting for someone to blink.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Week of geopolitical poker over Ukraine ends with no endgame in sight This week began with four European leaders, standing defiantly in Kyiv alongside Volodymyr Zelenskyy, issuing an ultimatum to Vladimir Putin: sign a ceasefire now, or together with Donald Trump we will force you to do so, with sanctions and other tough measures. Over the subsequent days, there followed a series of offers, counter-offers, ultimatums and deflections, in a dizzying week of high-stakes diplomacy". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
